title: William Robert Johnston Municipal Airport
text:
William Robert Johnston Municipal Airport is a city-owned public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located in <a href="Mendota%2C%20California">Mendota</a>, a city in <a href="Fresno%20County%2C%20California">Fresno County</a>, <a href="California">California</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility. It was known as Mendota Airport until 2008.
Facilities and aircraft.
William Robert Johnston Municipal Airport covers an area of 130 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (53 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 162 feet (49 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 15/33 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,499 by 50 feet (1,066 x 15 m). For the 12-month period ending July 28, 2011, the airport had 4,000 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 10 per day.
